review_blob:
0.5 bottle with sealing glass wrapped in dedicated box. Looks very stylish.
Pours pitch black with low, beige and short head. Beer stays on sides of the glass when swirled.
Aroma is very intense with notes of smoke, campfire, dried plums, chocolate, coffee, chicory coffee, roastiness and some alcoholic hints.
Taste is very well balanced. Chocolate sweetness devolves into coffee-like and roasty bitterness very smoothly with nice smokiness and plummy sourness in the background.
Full body. Oily and smooth texture. Low and smooth carbonation.
With all my love for Browar Pinta, their Imperator Batycki is outclassed by this one. Its a definition of a Baltic Porter. Definitely best Ive ever had and probably the best on the earth right now.

330ml bottle. Pours deep amber color with poor and short-lasting head. Very complex and balanced aroma: wood, vanilla, barnyard, citrus (tangerine!), overripe tropical fruits and some hints of bourbon. Taste, again, is very complex. There are plenty of tangerine-like sweetness, gentle sour notes and right after comes very pleasant and refreshing bitterness. Long finish. Great drinkability. Carbonation is definitely too low and its the one and only noticeable flaw of this beer. Its almost flat. Medium and soft body. While drinking this now I just strengthen my belief that it was the greatest beer of Beer Geek Madness 2. Ill go even further - this is one of best Polish beers right now.

Pours pale-yellow color with quite low, white head. Little hazy in glass. Quite poor lacing. Pleasure, strong and sweet aroma of tropical fruits (mostly mango), citrus, some grassy notes and a little bit of maltiness in the background. Coconut isnt present, maybe on the very edge of autosuggestion. Taste is quite sweet with quick, refreshing bitterness and fruit-like, sweet finish. I just want to take another sip. Medium body, low to medium carbonation. Coconut shreds didnt perform so well as I expected but its still damn good beer.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: Very dark brown color with medium-lasting, tan head. Complex aroma of dried plums, overripe banana, chocolate, chicory coffee, roastiness and wheat. Taste is well balanced. Medium sweetness with light bitterness and sourness. Medium carbonation, medium body and creamy texture. Great stuff.
beer_name: Schneider Weisse Tap X Meine Porter Weisse

review_blob: Black with short and unsustainable head. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malts vanilla and hints of alcohol. Taste is surprisingly sweet. Plenty of chocolate, coffe and some sour notes from roasted malts. Again, just like in Raspberry BA version, carbonation is to low. Still, mouthfeeling is great, very smooth and velvety. Overall I think its slightly better than the Raspbbery BA version.

Black colour with low and short-lasting head. Aroma of sour and sweet raspberries, chocolate, coffee, roasted malts and vanilla. Taste is also quite complex - plenty of coffee and chocolate with nice, fruity sourness. Very velvety body. The only essential flaw of this beer is carbonation which is too low in my opinion. Overall its great brew, Im glad I bought a bottle.
beer_name: Kingpin Turbo Geezer Raspberry Bourbon Barrel-Aged

review_blob: Very dark with very short-lasting, medium head. Aroma is sour with some roasty notes and hints of dark fruits. Taste reminds me black currant juice, also there are is some roastiness. Low bitterness. Medium carbonation. I like it, its drinkable and quite refreshing.

330ml bottle. Pours red color with pale-pink head which dissappears quickly. Aroma is overpowered by strong, wild notes with hints of fruits. Taste is sour and bitter. Strong cherry flavour. Medium carbonation. Unconventional but pleasant.

Clear & dark amber color with small, beige head. Aroma of toffee, burnt caramel & sugar, toasty with some herbal notes in the background. Taste is sweet with flavour of burnt caramel and dried fruits. Medium body, fine carbonation. Interesting and worth trying if you never tried altbier before.

Hazy, deep amber color with small, white head but its disappearing quite fast. Aroma is sweet & sour. Orange, mango, banana, belgian yeasts and some spices. Taste is sour with spicy flavour. Medium Bitterness. Quite dry. Medium body, soft & low carbonation (would be better with a bit higher one). Well, its good but I heard a lot of voices about how awesome this beer is and, to be honest, Im just a little bit disappointed. Still, its recommendable.

Quite clear amber color with tall & stable, white head. Intense and complex aroma (quite dominated by typical sorachi ace notes). Lychee, lemon, lime, grapes, corriander, orange, some resinous and grassy notes, hints of caramel & biscuit. Medium bitterness and nice load of sweet, fruity flavours. Medium body, avarage carbonation. Very good IPA.

Bottle. Pale, little hazy with small and very short-lasting, white head. Weak aroma of bread, grain, some sourish notes in the background. Taste is sweet & sour. Also a bit of a grainy. Medium body, low carbonation. Refreshing and drinkable. Quite odd but in positive way. Would be nice to have one on a hot day.

0.3 bottle poured into sensoric glass. Dark brown with quite short-lasting, tan head. Plenty of dark chocolate, some caramel and little of coffee, hoppy and roasty notes. Taste, again, is dominated by chocolate. Slightly sour from dark malts with herbal-like hoppy notes at the end. Light bodied (even a bit watery for a porter) with low carbo. Decent.

Bottle. Pitch black color with tall, lasting and light-brown head. Looks perfect. Leaves oily sediment on the sides of the glass when moved. Plenty of coffee in aroma, notes of chocolate, roasted malts, some sweet notes of dark fruits, hints of caramel and vanilla. Taste, again, is very roasty and coffee with a little bit of sweetness. High, roasty bitterness and alcoholic aftertaste but its quite noble and works well with other flavours. Oily, full body. Low carbonation. Had a Beer Weak version some time ago and it was better in terms of that coffee taste & aroma (felt like drinking good, cold brewed coffee with alcohol) but this one is way more complex. Great stuff.

Bottle. Jet black with medium and long lasting brown head. Very oily texture. It stays for long on the sides of the glass when moved. Aroma has plenty of vanilla upfront, chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, sugar. Smells like cake/biscuit with alcohol. Taste has dark-chocolate-like bitterness and plenty of sweetness after it. Also its quite alcoholic. Full body, low carbonation. Its nice but I expected more.

Pours rusty, reddish-brown color with very tall head. Aroma of wine, red currant, raisins, american hops, wild (belgian beer type) and some caramel notes in the background. Taste is rather dry. Malty with sour finish, little alcoholic. Medium, herbal-like bitterness. Medium bodied. Its definitely wild but its a bit overhelming for me. Still, its very good beer.

Golden and hazy. Aroma of flowers, sweet fruits (apples and pears mostly, maybe even some mirabelle from what I remember), herbs, lavender, some citrus and spicy notes. Very pleasant. Taste is quite sweet, mostly with same flavours which are present in aroma. Low to medium bitterness. Light body and medium carbonation. Interesting stuff.

Hazy, golden color with medium, white and medium-lasting head. Aroma of grain, bread, flowers, resin with just a note of citrus. Taste is grainy mostly with some fruity-sweetness and medium, resinous (even a bit stem-like) bitterness but its not overwhelming. Medium body, low carbonation. Nice and refreshing.

0.7 bottle, unfortunately few days after expiration date. Pours golden, little hazy with tall, white head. Aroma lacks that strong banana & cloves notes typical for weizen but I guess its fault of expiration date. Besides that there are some hoppy and wheat notes, a bit estery also. Dry, wheat taste with low bitterness and a bit sour finish. Low to medium body, very refreshing and drinkable. Decent. Im sure itd be better fresh.

Pale, yellow color with white, medium-lastingh head. Quite hazy. Plenty of orange in aroma. There are also some citrus, grain and oats. Clean and fresh taste which is malty, fruity and a bit spicy. Short finish. Very refreshing and drinkable. Low to medium carbonation. Great beer.
beer_name: Pays Flamand / Pinta - le Roi de lEt / Krl Lata

review_blob: Pale, yellowish color with small and short lasting head. Aroma of sour wheat, barnyard, spices and some flower and citrus notes. Medium bitterness with nice, sour finish. Very refreshing. Medium to high carbonation, drinkable. Nice beer for summer.

Dark amber with medium white head. Decent lacing. Very pleasant and sweet aroma of typical witbier notes mixed with hops. There are typical for witbier yeasty notes, plenty of orange, mango, banana, mirabelle. Taste is well balanced between sweetness and bitterness. Very drinkable and refreshing. Well done.

Pale, yellowish color with medium and short-lasting white head. Smoky aroma with some herbal-hoppy and grainy notes. Gentle smokiness and herbal bitterness in taste. Its quite high-hopped regarding the style. Medium carbonation. Refreshing and drinkable. Good.
beer_name: Jan Olbracht Rzemielniczy Piotrek z Bagien

review_blob: Dark amber color with medium, white head. Resin and citrus notes, some pineapple and caramel/burnt sugar. High bitterness and a bit long-lasting but on acceptable level. Rather low carbo. Nice.
beer_name: Jan Olbracht Rzemielniczy Piotrek z Bagien American IPA

review_blob: Little hazy, amber color with small, white head. Very strong aroma of earl grey and citrus with malty background. Taste follows aroma. It tastes almost like pure earl grey tea. Medium to high herbal-bitterness but its very pleasant and dont stays too long in mouth. Citrus accents made this quite refreshing. Low to medium carbonation. Very interesting and one of best beers Olimp ever made.

Clear golden color with quite high, frothy and short-lasting head. Nice lacing tho. Smells more like typical pilsner rather than APA. There are malts, some grassy-hops, slightly citrus. Taste also reminds me more of pilsner than pale ale. Slightly metalic, low bitterness. Low to medium carbonation. Well, I didnt expect a lot from this one but its worse than I thougt.

Light amber color with rather small and short-lasting head. Plenty of peach in this one, both in taste and aroma. There are also some sparkling wine, pear and yeasty notes. Taste sweet and sour. Perfect carbonation. Great stuff, probably my favourite fruit lambic so far.

Pours light amber with tall, white head which is quite stable with good lacing. Aroma of pineapple, citrus, mango, biscuits, caramel, slightly herbal, Sweet taste. Medium to high carbonation. Decent DIPA.

Bottle. Hazy, amber color with tall, white head. Looks great. Intense, fruity aroma. There are peach, orange, grapes, pineapple, slightly floral notes, caramel and burnt sugar. Quite sweet (which is ok, I prefer sweet DIPAs) with very pleasant bitterness. Some alcoholic notes after warming. Long finish. Full body and oily mouthfeel. Just like some kind of hop liqueur. Low carbonation. Good drinkability. Really, really good DIPA,

Black with beige, low and short-lasting head. Aroma just explodes with cinnamon. Theres also chocolate, gingerbread and sublte roasty aroma. Taste follows aroma. Again, plenty of cinnamon. Very sweet with low to medium bitterness. Low to medium carbonation. Interesting.

Very hazy, dark golden color with tall head. Aroma of citrus, grain, some tropical fruits and soap. Taste is a bit empty with citrus and subtle-metalic note. Also its too bitter which affects drinkability (which is characteristic for this style of beer, isnt it?). In the end its decent but there are lots of better examples of american wheat in Poland.

Bottle. Very pale yellow and hazy color with tall, white and frothy head which is quite short-lasting but leaves nice lacing. Aroma of smoke (cheesy), grain and some herbs. Dry taste. Smoked notes are more ham-like in contrast to aroma. Also, theres a strange, subtle mead-like note. Appropriate bitterness. Very refreshing with high carbonation. Great example of grodziskie.
Bottle. Clear, black color. Aroma is dominated by coffee with some chocolate and roasted notes. Sweet in taste. Smooth, delicate texture with low carbonation. Good, classic stout.

Clear, pale golden color with tall, white head. Aroma of malts, grapes, banana, spices, yeasts, some citrus notes and subtle alcohol. Very fresh. Quite sweet in taste, low bitterness. Medium to full body and high (maybe even little too high) carbonation. Nice stuff but itd be better and more drinkable with less carbonation.
beer_name: Pays Flamand / Pinta - Princesse du Printemps / Ksiniczka Wiosny

review_blob: Bottle. Pale, yellow color with medium and stable, white head. Lot of sediment. Aroma of yeasts, wheat, citrus, spices, pear, notes of bubblegum. Dry taste. Medium to high carbonation. Very good saison.

Pours dark amber and clear color with tall but short-lasting, frothy and white head. Aroma of malts, bread and hops. Taste is little sour with light bitterness. Quite refreshing and drinkable. Low carbonation. Decent stuff.

Hazy, pale amber color with good looking and stable, white head. Decent lacing. Aroma is yeasty, fruity (equinox did the job), little spicy. Taste is fruity with long, bitter finish and little sour. Oily, full body. Decent but not mindblowing.
Dark amber, clear. Medium, stable white head with good lacing. Aroma of resin, citrus, slightly fruity with some caramel accents. Medium and short bitterness. Low to medium carbonation. Decent IPA.
UPDATED: MAY 5, 2015

Bottle. Golden color (little hazy, typical for Doctor Brew) with a stable, white head. Good lacing. Very fruity aroma. There are mostly yellow fruits like mango, peach, apricot, mirabelle with some citrus and grape notes. Taste got that fruity sweetness with medium to high bitterness. Smooth texture, medium carbonation. Another great IPA from Doctor Brew, maybe even their best.

Almost black color with small and short-lasting head. Aroma of smoke, liquorice, dark malts and chocolate. Dry taste. Low bitterness and little of sourness beacuse of dark malts. Easy-drinking. Low carbonation. Decent.

Pours hazy copper color with medium, regular and quite stable tan head. Aroma is peated, nutty, woody, fruity with some burnt sugar and smoked plum notes. Taste is herbal and smoked with medium bitterness. Low to medium carbonation. Smooth and kinda creamy texture. Good stuff, I really enjoyed this one.

Pitch black color with small, short-lasting, tan head. Aroma of alcohol, vanilla, coffee and dark malts. Tastes quite sweet. Theres plenty of vanilla and coffee. Low to medium bitterness. A bit coffee-like sourness is also present. Creamy mouthfeel, low carbo. Surprisingly drinkable. Just another great beer from Kingpin Brewery and probably their best, chapeau bas!

Pours dark amber color, clear with small, unstable and irregular head. Aroma of strawberries, tropical fruits, citrus with malty background. Quite sweet in taste with medium bitterness and fruity aftertaste. Its well balanced. Low carbonation. Very refreshing and highly drinkable. Nice.
beer_name: Widawa West Coast IPA  Equinox Edition

review_blob: Bottle. Dark amber color with tall, white and stable head. Good lacing. Strong aroma of stem-like hops, slightly fruity after warming, some strange, sour note, burnt brown sugar and little of typical belgian aroma in background. Taste is sour with pure, blunt bitterness. Fruitness is unnoticeable in taste. Alcoholic aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Quite disappointing, its overhoped and clearly not balanced.

Had it on tap at BGM2 and now trying again with a bottle. Pours hazy golden color with tiny, white and short-lasting head. Aroma of grain, citrus, burnt sugar and coriander. Low bitterness. Very refreshing. Decent stuff.

Bottle poured into glass. Room tempeture. Clear, black colour with tall but short lasting head. Poor lacing. Decent aroma for a baltic porter. Roasty, dried fruits (plums mostly), raisins, dark chocolate and some alcoholic notes. Dry taste. Quite a lot of sourness from dark malts for this style of beer and (again) alcoholic aftertaste but its acceptable. Could have a little more body but it makes it surprisingly drinkable. Anyway, its really decent baltic porter, especially for a commercial one. If alcohol would be more hidden itd be better. Got potential for seasoning.

Hazy, golden color with minimal, ugly head. Aroma is ok, bubblegum, fruits and some coriander and hoppy notes. Taste is sweetish, spicy with little bitter finish. The problem of this beer is its totally flat, almost no carbonation. Feels like it stayed opened for a day or something. Too bad cause with proper carbonation it could be a really decent belgian ale.

Amber, hazy color with white, talk but short-lasting head. Very complex aroma of hops with lichi upfront. Also some caramel/biscuit notes after warming. Body could be little more liqueur. Low to medium carbonation. Great stuff.

Poured into glass. Pale yellow color with medium white but short-lasting head. Great aroma of american hops. Lemon, tangarine, grapefruit, pineapple, some resin notes. Taste starte with fruity sweetness and ends with very pleasant bitterness. Soft, medium carbonation. Very drinkable. Best IPA I?ve had so far.
